originalText.text:
Scam alert!!!!
Morning staff are rude and unprofessional and the lot is running a big time hustle to take advantage of displaced drivers.

(Since New Presbyterian has monopolized all of the local parking lots anyone that is not their employee is required to park here.)

Most lot a fee is from 1/2, up to 2 hrs up to 12hrs and with a max rate, NOT HERE.

Here they scam you with an 8 hr rate but considering most people work an 8hr day (9-5) etc when you return you're hot with a charge for 10hrs which is $10 more for than the 8hr rate.

Moral of the story it's cheaper to park on a NYC parking w/o paying and receive a $35 parking ticket than to waste $50 parking here.

Greedy business seems to be thriving well I'm an "underserved community"....ü§î

originalText.text: Dropped of the car in the morning , came to pick it up only to find out their credit card machine was not working. Had literally two dollars less than what I owed in my pocket, they would not except it, and I did not have my debit card with me. Offered to leave my cc card info with them they refused. A very nice bystander lent me to the money... a report to better business bureau is on the way.

originalText.text: Came back from my 12 hour shift to a dent on my passenger side door that was not there on drop off. Attendant when questioned had nothing to say and told me to come back when a manager was there. Attendant at drop off at 6:30 was asleep and took 5 min of me knocking on the window to wake him up. Never parking here again.

originalText.text: Went to the parking lot for lunch at BBQ. I have a SUV the attendant said $30 for 1 hour. What? Never heard of it. These no side in or around the lot indicating vehicle sizes.

originalText.text: Waited 50 minutes to have the car parked (with a prepaid reservation). It was NYRR race on a Sunday morning, but this is a yearly event that has been running for decades; this should not be new for this company. Booth attendant was unhelpful with communication, 2nd attendant was trying his best but only so much he could do. The SP+ company responds to alot of negative reviews here and they did contact me via text as a generic follow up to my reservation, however these responses of apologies/‚Äúsending feedback to management‚Äù are unacceptable given the frequency of dissatisfied customers. Only a handful of lots in this area, sometimes this zero star company will be your only choice. Parking lot also uses the address 1107 St Nicholas Ave.
